subject: Re: [junit] Swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: ... Most folks generally don t use the SwingUI in the main method, so it s a little different. This will work: junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(Your.class); Mike
messageBody:
parul_49 wrote:

>Hi,
>I am trying to write Junit test for some of the classes.
>This is my code :
> public static Test suite()
> {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(GetBanBillSummaryTest.class);
> return suite;
> }
>
> public static void main(String args[])
> {
> //junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> junit.swingui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> }
>

Most folks generally don't use the SwingUI in the main method, so it's a
little different.

This will work:

junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(Your.class);

Mike
